docs.lead_paragraph: The federal courts ruled that the Obama administration is using the wrong standards to determine if older Americans are entitled to Medicare coverage of skilled nursing home care and home health care.

headline.seo: Medicare Coverage Standards Are Too Strict, Courts Find
headline.main: Medicare Standards Are Too Strict, 2 Courts Find
headline.print_headline: Medicare Standards Are Too Strict, 2 Courts Find

docs.snippet: The federal courts ruled that the Obama administration is using the wrong standards to determine if older Americans are entitled to Medicare coverage of skilled nursing home care and home health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: If the Republicans gain control of the House of Representatives in Tuesday's election, as expected, attention shifts from the campaign trail to what the G.O.P. can do in practical terms to try to unravel pieces of the newly enacted health care overhaul.
docs.abstract: Governors' races may also foretell state actions to set up insurance exchanges, implement individual mandates and review insurance rates.
docs.snippet: Governors' races may also foretell state actions to set up insurance exchanges, implement individual mandates and review insurance rates.

docs.lead_paragraph: Candidates are making their final arguments, hoping to sway undecided voters in close races.
docs.snippet: Candidates are making their final arguments, hoping to sway undecided voters in close races.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative John Salazar and his challenger Scott Tipton in Colorado’s Third Congressional District have a get-out-the-vote challenge in a sprawling district.

headline.seo: John Salazar and Scott Tipton Battle for Congress
headline.main: Pledging Independence to Voters Here and Yon
headline.print_headline: Pledging Independence To Voters Here and Yon

docs.lead_paragraph: The two candidates in Mississippi’s Fourth Congressional District finally agreed to hold a debate.
